paper_title: Traces of Sobolev spaces to piecewise Ahlfors--David regular sets
abstract: Let $(\operatorname{X},\operatorname{d},μ)$ be a metric measure space with uniformly locally doubling measure $μ$. Given $p \in (1,\infty)$, assume that $(\operatorname{X},\operatorname{d},μ)$ supports a weak local $(1,p)$-Poincaré inequality. We characterize trace spaces of the first-order Sobolev $W^{1}_{p}(\operatorname{X})$-spaces to subsets $S$ of $\operatorname{X}$ that can be represented as a finite union $\cup_{i=1}^{N}S_{i}$, $N \in \mathbb{N}$ of Ahlfors--David regular subsets $S_{i} \subset \operatorname{X}$, $i \in \{1,...,N\}$ with different codimensions. Furthermore, we explicitly compute the corresponding trace norms up to some universal constants.
